channel.title: Quests on Unbounded School
channel.description: Recent content in Quests on Unbounded School

item.title: 5k Adventure
item.description:
Get ready for an awesome adventure to become a super stretcher and a 5K running champ! You’ll learn fun stretches, make a training schedule, and train to run 3.1 miles with a big smile.

Making a Training Plan

Open up Grok and introduce yourself. Grok will help you create a plan tailored specifically to you. To start the discussion, type in:

I'm a 9 year old girl and I'd like help creating a 5k training plan. 
I'm starting today, and my race is on October 18th. 
Let me tell you a bit about myself before you create the plan.

After the introduction, Grok will want to know 2 things:

item.title: Egg Free Baking
item.description:
Hi there, young baker! Baking is like magic—you mix simple things and turn them into yummy treats. This lesson is all about making egg-free cookies (maybe chocolate chip or something fun like that!), a super easy recipe that’s perfect for beginners. You’ll do most of it yourself, but remember: Always have a grown-up nearby for safety, especially with the oven.

Find a Recipe Online

Baking starts with a good plan! Recipes are like treasure maps that tell you exactly what to do. Today, we’re making egg-free cookies because they’re yummy and safe for everyone—even if someone can’t eat eggs. You get to pick your own recipe this time!

item.title: Grok & Quill
item.description:
Daily Writing

Hey there, writer! Grab your journal and write about your day, a book, or a fun discussion. Make it awesome!

Watch this video, then use one of its 6 cool tips in your writing. You got this!

Grading with Grok

Next, practice typing! Type up your journal entry for some keyboard fun.

item.title: Habitat-orama
item.description: A diorama is like a tiny world you build to show a scene, like a forest, desert, or even a superhero hideout! It’s a small model made on a base, like a piece of cardboard, where you add things like grass, rocks, trees, or buildings to make it look real. Think of it as a 3D picture you can touch, kind of like a toy set or a scene from a movie, but you make it yourself with crafts! It’s fun because you get to create every part of your little world.

item.title: Hunt & Sketch
item.description:
Geography: Finding Korea

Open the Apple Maps app on your iPad. Pinch to zoom out super far—you’ll see the whole globe! Spot South Korea and Kansas. Fun hunt, right?

Hey explorer! Use Apple Maps, Grok, or Google to answer these cool questions:

  1. What’s the capital of South Korea?
  2. Could you walk to South Korea from Kansas? What about sailing there by boat?
  3. How many miles from Kansas to South Korea’s capital?
  4. How long to fly that adventure?
  5. What’s South Korea’s time zone? Kansas’s? If it’s 3 PM in Kansas, what’s the time in South Korea?

Culture: K-Pop & Demons

The movie K-Pop Demon Hunters pulls from real Korean tales. Watch this video to discover awesome cultural bits!

item.title: World Animals
item.description:
Find Your Animal

Lots of cool animals live all over the world! Some call certain continents home, while others love places like hot tropics or dry deserts. These are their special habitats. Can you discover some fun facts about 1 animal in each of these 8 places?

North America South America Asia Australia Africa Farm Animals Tropics Reptiles

Reference the animals found in Sedgwick County Zoo for a list of what’s available to see in person.
